TabObserver

The purpose of this class is to keep track of all tabs loaded by firefox.  This class will allow other objects to subscribe to tab events.  This class will track these tab events: Add / Remove Tab Select / Unselect Tab

Usage

Monitoring tabs are especially important for extensions that

1.  Manipulate the DOM of the loaded page.  2. Set states of the extension relative to the selected tab.

Summary
TabObserver
The purpose of this class is to keep track of all tabs loaded by firefox.
Functions
TabObserver
Initializes the Object
init
Initialize the listeners for all the various tab events and forcefully add a tab to the tab_observer if there are no other tabs open.
tab_selected
Find the selected tab from the tabs array.
tab_added
Called whenever a tab is added to the browser.
tab_moved
Called whenever a tab is moved in the tab browser.
tab_removed
Called whenever a tab is removed from the browser.
tab_event
Generic event responder that is called by the various listeners.
add_tab
This method adds a new instance of the Tab class to the newly created Tab in the firefox browser.
remove_tab
This method removes an existing instance of the Tab class that was associated with the Tab removed from the firefox browser.
new_tab
Determine if the tab that triggered the event was new or not.
reindexTabs
Reindex the internal tab array to correspond with the indexs of their associated tabs in the Firefox tabbrowser array.
selected_tab
This function will return the corresponding tab object that corresponds to the selected tab.
find_tab_by_panel_id
The function will search for a tab based on a panel_id provided by a parameter.

Functions

TabObserver

TabObserver = function(pmog,
force)

Initializes the Object

Parameters

forceboolean.  In some cases we may need to restart the extension when the browser is already loaded in these cases pass force = true to bypass the normal window load listener.

init

TabObserver.prototype.init = function()

Initialize the listeners for all the various tab events and forcefully add a tab to the tab_observer if there are no other tabs open.

tab_selected

TabObserver.prototype.tab_selected = function(event)

Find the selected tab from the tabs array.  Special Note: In some cases the AddTab event will fire after the TabSelect event, which means the newly selected tab has not been added to the tabs array yet.

Parameters

eventThe event that triggered the tab_select event

tab_added

TabObserver.prototype.tab_added = function(event)

Called whenever a tab is added to the browser.

Parameters

eventThe event that triggered the tab_added event.

tab_moved

TabObserver.prototype.tab_moved = function(event)

Called whenever a tab is moved in the tab browser.

Parameters

eventThe event that triggered the tab_moved event.

tab_removed

TabObserver.prototype.tab_removed = function(event)

Called whenever a tab is removed from the browser.

Parameters

eventThe event that triggered the tab_removed event.

tab_event

TabObserver.prototype.tab_event = function(event,
type)

Generic event responder that is called by the various listeners.

Parameters

eventThe event that triggered the tab event.
typeThe type of tab event that occurred.

add_tab

TabObserver.prototype.add_tab = function(panel_id)

This method adds a new instance of the Tab class to the newly created Tab in the firefox browser.

Parameters

panel_idThe id that corresponds to the panel_id of a tab in the Firefox browser.

remove_tab

TabObserver.prototype.remove_tab = function(panel_id)

This method removes an existing instance of the Tab class that was associated with the Tab removed from the firefox browser.

Parameters

panel_idThe id that corresponds to the panel_id of a tab in the Firefox browser.

new_tab

TabObserver.prototype.new_tab = function(panel_id)

Determine if the tab that triggered the event was new or not.

Returns

true or false depending on newness of tab

reindexTabs

TabObserver.prototype.reindexTabs = function()

Reindex the internal tab array to correspond with the indexs of their associated tabs in the Firefox tabbrowser array.

selected_tab

TabObserver.prototype.selected_tab = function()

This function will return the corresponding tab object that corresponds to the selected tab.

Returns

tab instance

find_tab_by_panel_id

TabObserver.prototype.find_tab_by_panel_id = function(panel_id)

The function will search for a tab based on a panel_id provided by a parameter.  Parameters:

panel_idThe id that corresponds to the panel_id of a tab in the Firefox browser.

Returns

an instance of the Tab class.
